title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Why a Dehumidifier Is One of My Favorite Gadgets
items.description: A good dehumidifier can banish damp and mold, and help you keep a comfortable temperature in your home.

items.title: Figure Skaters at the 2026 Winter Olympics Are Pushing the Limits of What’s Possible
items.description: For years, quad axel jumps seemed impossible. Then Ilia Malinin landed one in 2022. As he heads to the Milano Cortina Games, everyone wants to know wh...

items.title: Public Health Workers Are Quitting Over Assignments to Guantánamo
items.description: Doctors, nurses, and other officers are increasingly being deployed to ICE detention centers. Some have resigned in protest, while others offer a rare...

items.title: Why the Artemis II Crew Stays in Quarantine Before Their Journey to Moon
items.description: For two weeks, medical experts monitor the astronauts as they remain indoors, live in isolation, and avoid physical touch, all to prevent harmful micr...

items.title: What Paralympic Athlete Monster Mike Schultz Packs for His Races
items.description: The world champion adaptive snowboard cross athlete repairs his own prostheses before a competition.

items.title: Reddit looks to AI search as its next big opportunity
items.description: During the company's fourth-quarter earnings call on Thursday, it offered an update on its plans to merge traditional and AI search together and hinte...

items.title: Sapiom raises $15M to help AI agents buy their own tech tools
items.description: The startup -- with backing from Accel -- is building a financial layer that handles the authentication and micro-payments required for AI agents.

items.title: Amazon and Google are winning the AI capex race — but what’s the prize?
items.description: In 2026, Amazon plans to spend $200 billion in capex. Google is just behind at $175 billion to $185 billion. It's a lot of money!

items.title: The Washington Post is retreating from Silicon Valley when it matters most
items.description: The Bezos-owned newspaper gutted its San Francisco bureau and coverage of tech — including journalists reporting on Amazon and Blue Origin.

items.title: AWS revenue continues to soar as cloud demand remains high
items.description: AWS recorded its best quarter, in terms of revenue growth, in 13 quarters in Q4 2025 as AI drives AWS adoption.
